cyclone.name: SALLY
cyclone.current_location: about 75 miles south of Mobile Alabama
cyclone.trajectory: Very slow northward drift, then turning northeast and moving inland across Alabama and into Georgia
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: north-central Gulf Coast near the Alabama–Florida border (Gulf Shores–Pensacola area)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical Storm Warning from east of Navarre FL to Indian Pass FL; Hurricane Warning east of Bay St. Louis MS to Navarre FL
weather_observation.warning_coast: Storm Surge Warning from the Mouth of the Mississippi River to the Okaloosa/Walton County Line FL, including Mobile Bay
weather_observation.impacted_coast: North-central Gulf Coast (southeastern MS, AL coast, western FL Panhandle)
weather_observation.wind: Occasional outer-band gusts 25–35 mph possible, but sustained tropical-storm winds unlikely
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected at Port Manatee (forecast surge zone begins well north of Tampa Bay)
weather_observation.rainfall: Outer rainbands could deliver 1–2 inches; widespread flooding threat stays north of the port
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated brief tornado possible in outer rainbands, but overall tornado risk low at the port
